title: Whom do you like most and why- Malala Yousafzai or Nadia Murad? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A @Meenakshi Thakur Shukla (मीनाक्षी ठाकुर शुक्ला) I would like to go with Nadia Murad. She is far better than Malala. Malala just played for publicity. When she and her friends were shot by the Tehrik e Taliban terrorists in Swat valley,she went to London for treatment and never came back to Pakistan. Whereas her friends are still studying in the same school in Swat valley,Pakistan.  Let's talk about Nadia Murad. She received Noble peace prize alongwith Dr. Dennis Mekwege. Nadia Murad Basee Taha (Arabic: نادية مراد باسي طه‎; born 1993) is an Iraqi Yazidi human rights activist who lives in Germany.[3] In 2014 she was kidnapped from her hometown Kocho and held by the Islamic State for three months. After being sold as a sex slave to ISIS fighters and escaping, Nadia Murad became a powerful advocate against sexual violence, particularly as a weapon in conflict. Murad’s advocacy has helped Yazidi survivors of genocide and sexual violence seek justice. Like Murad, the UN Global Goals call for an end to violence against women and children. Yazidi activist Nadia Murad was just awarded the Nobel Peace Prize and $500,000 in prize money for her work campaigning for justice for her community, which has been terrorized by ISIS — and she’s using every penny of it to fight against sexual violence and trafficking. Murad promised in a press conference on Monday to use 100% of the prize money to support Nadia’s Initiative, the organization she founded, to advocate for victims of genocide and human trafficking and to help communities in need. Now,some more interesting facts about this beautiful and brave lady: Nadia Murad, a Yazidi woman who survived horrific abuse at the hands of the Islamic State (IS) militant group, has revealed she is engaged to a fellow Yazidi human rights activist. The 25-year-old said "the struggle for our people" brought her together with Abid Shamdeen. The announcement comes days after the fourth anniversary of the IS attack on Ms Murad's village, Kocho. Six of her brothers were killed in the massacre, and she was kidnapped.  Cute couple,aren’t they? Malala has guts to go to Japan,where female literacy is 99%,but she never went to Pakistan where still women are deprived of basic human rights. She is a fake humanist. Nadia is a humanist by deed,not by publicity. Please go to my this answer: Harsha Aditya's answer to What are the most extreme examples of hypocrisy? Thanks for reading. Regards.
